      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: heap UaF in DesksTemplates dialog
          (was: Security: heap-use-after-free ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc:434:26 in views::DialogDelegate::CancelDialog())
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          shidi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          richui@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. Otherwise this can be reached through<span class="line"><!---->    // if the cancel button is available. Otherwise this can be reached through<!----></span><br>    // closing the dialog via Esc.<span class="line"><!---->    // closing the dialog via Esc.<!----></span><br>    if (ShouldShowCloseButton())<span class="line"><!---->    if (ShouldShowCloseButton())<!----></span><br>      DCHECK(IsDialogButtonEnabled(ui::DIALOG_BUTTON_CANCEL));<span class="line"><!---->      DCHECK(IsDialogButtonEnabled(ui::DIALOG_BUTTON_CANCEL));<!----></span><br><br>    if (already_started_close_ || !Cancel())<span class="line"><!---->    if (already_started_close_ || !Cancel())<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br><br>    already_started_close_ = true;                     // crash here<span class="line"><!---->    already_started_close_ = true;                     // crash here<!----></span><br>    GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->    GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(<!----></span><br>        views::Widget::ClosedReason::kCancelButtonClicked);<span class="line"><!---->        views::Widget::ClosedReason::kCancelButtonClicked);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>From that crash location, we can deduce that:<span class="line"><!---->From that crash location, we can deduce that:<!----></span><br>1. already_started_close_ was valid when it was checked just above (or we would have crashed earlier with a read)<span class="line"><!---->1. already_started_close_ was valid when it was checked just above (or we would have crashed earlier with a read)<!----></span><br>2. Cancel() returned true, for us to reach the crash line<span class="line"><!---->2. Cancel() returned true, for us to reach the crash line<!----></span><br>3. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<span class="line"><!---->3. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<!----></span><br><br>So, Cancel() must have led to the destruction of the receiving DialogDelegate.<span class="line"><!---->So, Cancel() must have led to the destruction of the receiving DialogDelegate.<!----></span><br><br>Cancel() does this:<span class="line"><!---->Cancel() does this:<!----></span><br><br>  bool DialogDelegate::Cancel() (cancel_callback_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (cancel_callback_)<!----></span><br>      RunCloseCallback(std::move(cancel_callback_));<span class="line"><!----> DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() {<!----></span><br>    views::FocusManager* focus_manager = name_view_->OnContentsChanged();<span class="line"><!---->    name_view_-&gt;OnContentsChanged();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>and in fact, there it is in the call stack for the destroy:<span class="line"><!---->and in fact, there it is in the call stack for the destroy:<!----></span><br><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in show itself again:<span class="line"><!---->so the Cancel callback is, in fact, indirectly causing the dialog to show itself again:<!----></span><br><br>    #10 0x556799922016 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<span class="line"><!---->    #20 0x556798fd0d51 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<!----></span><br>    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<span class="line"><!---->    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<!----></span><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <span class="line"><!---->    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<span class="line"><!---->After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. But now it's fixed and the above issue can't be reproduced under current ToT.<span class="line"><!----> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. But now it's fixed and the above issue can't be reproduced under current ToT.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The update to the feature functionality that introduced this UaF also wasn't made until M101.<!----></span><br><br>Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<span class="line"><!---->Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<!----></span><br><br>Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101. Was it by accident that the M100 label was added, or was it actually found in M100 as well?<span class="line"><!---->Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101.         for LitElement.

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            min-height: 0;

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1301148%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2900" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1301148%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2900%252526ust%25253D1703406795886735%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1S0ZhOHR66oAeXNKztHQEv%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<span class="line"><!---->1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<!----></span><br>2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<span class="line"><!---->2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<!----></span><br>3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<!----></span><br><br>The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name. When hit cancel button UaF triggered.<span class="line"><!---->The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name.         Re #6: <span class="line"><!---->Re #6: <!----></span><br>Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <span class="line"><!---->Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <!----></span>issue #1284138<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1284138" title="heap-use-after-free base/memory/scoped_refptr.h:261:43 in operator bool (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1284138<!----></a>. <span class="line"><!---->. <!----></span><br><br>>> Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<!----></span><br>I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<span class="line"><!---->I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. This does look like a potential recent regression; however, I did not reproduce due the POC and also finding this bug in non-sheriffing duties, but wanted to get it to an owner to confirm or dispel any of my notions or assumptions above. <span class="line"><!---->This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered.         I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<span class="line"><!---->    #20 0x556798fd0d51 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<!----></span><br>    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<span class="line"><!---->    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<!----></span><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <span class="line"><!---->    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;

          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          min-height: 100%;

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

            min-height: 0;

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<span class="line"><!---->1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<!----></span><br>2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<span class="line"><!---->2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<!----></span><br>3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<!----></span><br><br>The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name. When hit cancel button UaF triggered.<span class="line"><!---->The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name. When hit cancel button UaF triggered.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>Not Crash<span class="line"><!---->Not Crash<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>==402541==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: heap UaF in DesksTemplates dialog
          (was: Security: heap-use-after-free ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc:434:26 in views::DialogDelegate::CancelDialog())
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          shidi@chromium.org

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. Otherwise this can be reached through<span class="line"><!---->    // if the cancel button is available. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<span class="line"><!---->3. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<!----></span><br><br>So, Cancel() must have led to the destruction of the receiving DialogDelegate.<span class="line"><!---->So, Cancel() must have ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<span class="line"><!---->After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. But now it's fixed and the above issue can't be reproduced under current ToT.<span class="line"><!----> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. But now it's fixed and the above issue can't be reproduced under current ToT.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301148#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1301148: Security: heap UaF in DesksTemplates dialog
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1301148: Security: heap UaF in DesksTemplates dialog
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<span class="line"><!---->1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<!----></span><br>2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<span class="line"><!---->2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<!----></span><br>3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<!----></span><br><br>The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name. When hit cancel button UaF triggered.<span class="line"><!---->The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name.         Re #6: <span class="line"><!---->Re #6: <!----></span><br>Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <span class="line"><!---->Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <!----></span>issue #1284138<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1284138" title="heap-use-after-free base/memory/scoped_refptr.h:261:43 in operator bool (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1284138<!----></a>. <span class="line"><!---->. <!----></span><br><br>>> Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<!----></span><br>I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<span class="line"><!---->I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Untriaged
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>

        This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. This does look like a potential recent regression; however, I did not reproduce due the POC and also finding this bug in non-sheriffing duties, but wanted to get it to an owner to confirm or dispel any of my notions or assumptions above. <span class="line"><!---->This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. TY!<span class="line"><!---->ellyjones@ could you PTAL and confirm or correct the above and I would be happy to update and move forward accordingly.         <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>

        I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<span class="line"><!---->    #20 0x556798fd0d51 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<!----></span><br>    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<span class="line"><!---->    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<!----></span><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <span class="line"><!---->    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

          align-items: stretch;
        }

          display: none;
        }

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/98.0.4758.102 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<span class="line"><!---->1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<!----></span><br>2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<span class="line"><!---->2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<!----></span><br>3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<!----></span><br><br>The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name.         Re #6: <span class="line"><!---->Re #6: <!----></span><br>Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <span class="line"><!---->Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <!----></span>issue #1284138<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1284138" title="heap-use-after-free base/memory/scoped_refptr.h:261:43 in operator bool (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1284138<!----></a>. <span class="line"><!---->. <!----></span><br><br>>> Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<!----></span><br>I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<span class="line"><!---->I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code.         This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. This does look like a potential recent regression; however, I did not reproduce due the POC and also finding this bug in non-sheriffing duties, but wanted to get it to an owner to confirm or dispel any of my notions or assumptions above. <span class="line"><!---->This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered.         I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. Otherwise this can be reached through<span class="line"><!---->    // if the cancel button is available. Otherwise this can be reached through<!----></span><br>    // closing the dialog via Esc.<span class="line"><!---->    // closing the dialog via Esc.<!----></span><br>    if (ShouldShowCloseButton())<span class="line"><!---->    if (ShouldShowCloseButton())<!----></span><br>      DCHECK(IsDialogButtonEnabled(ui::DIALOG_BUTTON_CANCEL));<span class="line"><!---->      DCHECK(IsDialogButtonEnabled(ui::DIALOG_BUTTON_CANCEL));<!----></span><br><br>    if (already_started_close_ || !Cancel())<span class="line"><!---->    if (already_started_close_ || !Cancel())<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br><br>    already_started_close_ = true;                     // crash here<span class="line"><!---->    already_started_close_ = true;                     // crash here<!----></span><br>    GetWidget()->CloseWithReason(<span class="line"><!---->    GetWidget()-&gt;CloseWithReason(<!----></span><br>        views::Widget::ClosedReason::kCancelButtonClicked);<span class="line"><!---->        views::Widget::ClosedReason::kCancelButtonClicked);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>From that crash location, we can deduce that:<span class="line"><!---->From that crash location, we can deduce that:<!----></span><br>1. already_started_close_ was valid when it was checked just above (or we would have crashed earlier with a read)<span class="line"><!---->1. already_started_close_ was valid when it was checked just above (or we would have crashed earlier with a read)<!----></span><br>2. Cancel() returned true, for us to reach the crash line<span class="line"><!---->2. Cancel() returned true, for us to reach the crash line<!----></span><br>3. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<span class="line"><!---->3. Cancel() made already_started_close_ become invalid<!----></span><br><br>So, Cancel() must have led to the destruction of the receiving DialogDelegate.<span class="line"><!---->So, Cancel() must have led to the destruction of the receiving DialogDelegate.<!----></span><br><br>Cancel() does this:<span class="line"><!---->Cancel() does this:<!----></span><br><br>  bool DialogDelegate::Cancel() (cancel_callback_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (cancel_callback_)<!----></span><br>      RunCloseCallback(std::move(cancel_callback_));<span class="line"><!---->
