views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<span class="line"><!---->    #20 0x556798fd0d51 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<!----></span><br>    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<span class="line"><!---->    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<!----></span><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <span class="line"><!---->    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>

Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<span class="line"><!---->1. Linux-chromeOS Chromium 101.0.4914.0<!----></span><br>2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<span class="line"><!---->2. Enable features DeskTemplates and setup dual display<!----></span><br>3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open new browser and save as templates templates then do one more save templates, when dialog popup replace templates? hit cancel button.<!----></span><br><br>The systems didn't generate a new file name for the new templates name, so It asks to replace the current template name.         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<span class="line"><!---->After some test and investigation I think this bug is now fixed on ToT by this change (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508507<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. But now it's fixed and the above issue can't be reproduced under current ToT.<span class="line"><!----> when I narrow down the trigger I find out the root cause was the focus timing issue when there are multiple displays, same issue could happen by just saving a template under same desk. I checked out both the newest M100 and M101 versions, and was not able to reproduce in either. The update to the feature functionality that introduced this UaF also wasn't made until M101.<span class="line"><!---->Through further investigation, this looks to only be an issue that was originally found in M101, but was fixed before the M101 branch (landed in 101.0.4938.0). I checked out both the newest M100 and M101 versions, and was not able to reproduce in either. The update to the feature functionality that introduced this UaF also wasn't made until M101.<!----></span><br><br>Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<span class="line"><!---->Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<!----></span><br><br>Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101. Was it by accident that the M100 label was added, or was it actually found in M100 as well?<span class="line"><!---->Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101.    f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==402541==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==402541==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before?         This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301148#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by

        <div>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301148#c30">Comment 30<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Mar 25, 2022, 6:09 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Through further investigation, this looks to only be an issue that was originally found in M101, but was fixed before the M101 branch (landed in 101.0.4938.0). I checked out both the newest M100 and M101 versions, and was not able to reproduce in either. The update to the feature functionality that introduced this UaF also wasn't made until M101.<span class="line"><!---->Through further investigation, this looks to only be an issue that was originally found in M101, but was fixed before the M101 branch (landed in 101.0.4938.0). I checked out both the newest M100 and M101 versions, and was not able to reproduce in either. The update to the feature functionality that introduced this UaF also wasn't made until M101.<!----></span><br><br>Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<span class="line"><!---->Based on this, this should not be an issue anymore.<!----></span><br><br>Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101. Was it by accident that the M100 label was added, or was it actually found in M100 as well?<span class="line"><!---->Looks like from the description of the bug, this was also found in M101. Was it by accident that the M100 label was added, or was it actually found in M100 as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        </div>

        Re #6: <span class="line"><!---->Re #6: <!----></span><br>Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <span class="line"><!---->Sorry for delayed. This issue similar with <!----></span>issue #1284138<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1284138" title="heap-use-after-free base/memory/scoped_refptr.h:261:43 in operator bool (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1284138<!----></a>. <span class="line"><!---->. <!----></span><br><br>>> Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Can you also upload tools  and results to show how this is can be used as an attack on an actual ChormeOS device?<!----></span><br>I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<span class="line"><!---->I'm sorry I currently do not have any tools requested and  for the Uaf issue an attacker can use a UAF to pass arbitrary code (or a reference to it) to a program and use a dangling pointer to navigate to the beginning of the code. In this way, malicious code execution can allow attackers to control the victim's system.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Untriaged
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>

        This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. This does look like a potential recent regression; however, I did not reproduce due the POC and also finding this bug in non-sheriffing duties, but wanted to get it to an owner to confirm or dispel any of my notions or assumptions above. <span class="line"><!---->This bug managed to slip through the security sheriff queue, this is a UAF in the browser process, but requires a bit of set up and complicated and significant user interaction to trigger, thus I do not consider this a release blocking issue for M100, which it is presently considered. TY!<span class="line"><!---->ellyjones@ could you PTAL and confirm or correct the above and I would be happy to update and move forward accordingly.         <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>

        I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<span class="line"><!---->I don't own any of //ash/wm or know this code, but I am at least somewhat familiar with DialogDelegateView and its ilk so I can try to provide some guidance.<!----></span><br><br>The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<span class="line"><!---->The actual object being used-after-free is a DialogDelegate subclass, since we're crashing with a 1-byte write at //ui/views/window/dialog_delegate.cc line 434. That's inside DialogDelegate::Cancel():<!----></span><br><br>  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<span class="line"><!---->  void DialogDelegate::CancelDialog() {<!----></span><br>    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<span class="line"><!---->    // If there's a close button available, this callback should only be reachable<!----></span><br>    // if the cancel button is available. views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<span class="line"><!---->    #20 0x556798fd0d51 in views::NativeWidgetAura::Activate() ui/views/widget/native_widget_aura.cc:652:56<!----></span><br>    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<span class="line"><!---->    #21 0x556798ee3c1b in views::FocusManager::SetFocusedViewWithReason(views::View*, views::FocusManager::FocusChangeReason) ui/views/focus/focus_manager.cc:361:14<!----></span><br>    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <span class="line"><!---->    #22 0x5567999205ad in ash::DesksTemplatesItemView::RevertTemplateName() <!----></span><br><br>... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<span class="line"><!---->... but it does so while the previous instance is still destroying itself, which results in a UAF when the stack unwinds enough for the cancellation of the original dialog to finish.<!----></span><br><br>It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<span class="line"><!---->It is really not a good idea to rely on OnViewBlurred() as a signal of a specific user action, as DesksTemplatesItemView::OnViewBlurred() does - views can be focused or blurred almost at Views' whim, and especially when there are multiple windows in play. I think this code will need to be restructured so that the dialog only shows in response to a real user action, not in response to a focus loss.<!----></span><br><br>That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<span class="line"><!---->That said, I am not the right person to actually fix this, since I don't know what DesksTemplatesItemView is or how to invoke it. Over to shidi@, cc richui@ :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
